name: local_authority_climate_emergency_declarations
title: Local authority climate emergency declarations
description: Dataset of local authority declarations of a climate emergency with key features flagged

resources.title: Local authority climate emergency declarations
resources.description: Dataset of local authority declarations of a climate emergency with key features flagged
resources.name: declarations

fields.name: made_declaration
fields.description: Has the council made a declaration of a climate emergency?

fields.name: ref_to_adaptation
fields.description: Does the declaration refer to adaptation?

fields.name: ecological_emergency
fields.description: Does the declaration refer to an ecological emergency?

fields.name: ref_to_nature
fields.description: Does the declaration refer to nature?
fields.example: "City leaders can and need to make changes to... biodiversity policy"

fields.name: call_to_gov
fields.description: Does the declaration call on the government to take action?
fields.example: ? - minutes not online as transferring to new system

fields.name: carbon_neutral_date
fields.description: Date by which the council aims to be carbon neutral

fields.name: carbon_neutral_whole_date
fields.description: Date by which the council aims to be carbon neutral (whole area)

fields.name: notes
fields.example: *"The council supports measures to address the climate emergency"

fields.name: local-authority-type-name
fields.description: Type of council (unitary, county, district, etc)

fields.name: county-la
fields.description: Code of overlapping county council of council

fields.name: combined-authority
fields.description: Code of overlapping combined authority of council

data.council: Neath Port Talbot County Borough Council

data.ref_to_nature: Yes "We have a strong track record in our sustainability and environment stewardship. We have engaged in climate change actions for many years and, through policies and activities, have made the district more resilient, reduced carbon emissions, created space for nature, and provided the infrastructure to enable others to make choices that reduce emissions. Going forward, we will be taking more actions in every area of our day-to-day activities, in our operations, our civic buildings and depots, improving our natural environment to support nature recovery, as well as gaining a better understanding and measurement of what the issues are and what our actions are achieving.A Sustainability Advisory Member Panel will now set actions to address the climate and nature emergency and will present a report to full Council in February 2022.
Yes, "extinctions of plant, insect and animal species"
